bibl.title: Dougherty v. Dawsson.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: In the Dist. Court of the 3d Jud. Dist. of Washt. Tery. holding terms at Steilacon for Pierce County-
To the Sheriff of Pierce County Greeting E Powell, Price

In the name of the United States you are hereby considered to subpoena Succe Tacoma, F.A. Potter of Tacoma to e and appear, in the Court-room in the town of Statacoon, before the Hon OJacobs, Judge of the 3d, Jud. Dist, on the tenth day of March AD 1874, at one o'Clock in the ap of that day -
Then and there to testify in a certain cause to be heard before the Hon. Court, wherein John Dougherty compliance of illegal imprisonment, and seeks his liberty on Writ of Habeas Corpus-

The words "Duces Secum" requires that he shall bring with him and produce in court all books and papers in his the examination of which will therein light upon the matter at , the send looks and papers being those in the case wherein Peace Banta
if plaintiff and John Doughtery if defendant and are as follows, to end Affidavits, Bonds, Writ of Arrest Command and Record of the whole proceedings--
Witness the Hon. OJacobs Chief Justice of Wash. Tert. Judge of 3d. Jud. Districts on the day of March AD 1874 John Palton, Clerk

I hereby certify that the within subpena came to hand th day of March 1874 and was resved in the Town of Tacoma Pierce County W.T. on the within warned witness on the 9th day of March A.D. 1874. D.W.C. Dawson Sheriff By G.M.Gravings Dept

p.del: Bontes vs Dougherty Sheriff To divving by witness 40 "mla to or (28) 2.80
